channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2025020864
item.description:
Report X-2025020864

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-12
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: USING DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR CORRSIVE LIQUIDS AND WEARING PROPER PPE. THE LEAK WAS CONTAINED AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. ONE OF THREE, ONE-GALLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS WAS CRUSHED, RESULTING IN ALL FOUR GALLON CONTAINERS BEING CONTAMINATED AND DAMAGED.

item.title: Report I-2025020011
item.description:
Report I-2025020011

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-29
  • City: Chicago
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Passenger had vaping pen on their person and felt it getting hot. Passenger gave it to the flight attendant and there the battery went into thermal runaway and fire was seen coming from the device. Fire was extinguished and device was cooled. Device was then placed in the onboard fire containment bag and more water added. Device was monitored until landing in MDW and then it was given to local SWA Ground Ops personnel. Passenger was not using the device at the time it started getting hot., After landing, passenger deplaned and never spoke with SWA so we could get their information.

item.title: Report X-2025020662
item.description:
Report X-2025020662

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-17T21:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-08
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UINTED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: NEAR BAY 29 AT THE HAZMAT AUDITOR STATION, AUDITOR NOTICED CORROSIVE HAZMAT PACKAGE HAD A WET SPOT ON A BOTTOM CORNER AND ON THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE. DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS ON THERE WAY TO ANOTHER SPILL WHEN AUDITOR TOLD RESPONDER ABOUT THE HAZMAT PACKAGE HAVING WET SPOT. SINCE THE PACKAGE WASN'T LEAKING OUT OF THE BOX, RESPONDER MADE SURE TO CONTAINERIZE THE HAZMAT PACKAGE AND ISOLATED IT FROM THE HAZMAT AUDITOR WORK STATION.

item.title: Report E-2025020213
item.description:
Report E-2025020213

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-17T21:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0143 ET, BCH notified ERTS about a cargo release inside trailer #3117938. It was reported 5 gallons of carbocoat released from a 5-gallon metal bucket. The caller reported the spill was caused due to a forklift accident. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined terminal personnel can clean the release with PPE on site. The caller reported the spill will be picked up with oil dri and placed into a 20-gallon poly drum. ERTS notified Chem-Trec of the release and spoke to Greg. Greg provided report #2024011700011.
